title: Combining Tense and Contour
goal: Learn to combine pu/ca/ba with co'a/ca'o/mo'u.

sections.content:
New Material (5-7 min)

Combining Tense + Contour

You can combine WHEN (tense) with WHICH PART (contour):

Past + Contour

Combination Meaning Example
puca'o was ongoing mi puca'o citka (I was eating)
puco'a had begun mi puco'a gunka (I had started working)
pumo'u had completed mi pumo'u ciska (I had finished writing)

Future + Contour

Combination Meaning Example
baco'a will begin mi baco'a gunka (I will start working)
bamo'u will complete mi bamo'u tcidu (I will finish reading)
baca'o will be ongoing mi baca'o sipna (I will be sleeping)

Examples in Context

mi puca'o tavla .i do co'a tavla

I was talking. You began talking.

mi pumo'u citka .i ba mi gunka

I had finished eating. Then I will work.

Order Matters

Tense comes first, then contour:

  • pu + ca'o = puca'o (was ongoing)
  • ba + co'a = baco'a (will begin)

Key Point

Combine tense (pu/ca/ba) with contour (co'a/ca'o/mo'u) for precise temporal description.

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Identify Combinations

What does each mean?

  1. puca'o →
  2. baco'a →
  3. pumo'u →
  4. bamo'u →
Answers
  1. was ongoing (in the middle of, in the past)
  2. will begin
  3. had completed
  4. will complete

Exercise 2: Translate

Translate:

  1. I was eating.
  2. I will start working.
  3. I had finished writing.
Answers
  1. mi puca'o citka
  2. mi baco'a gunka
  3. mi pumo'u ciska

Exercise 3: Narrative

Tell a story using combinations:

  1. I was sleeping.
  2. I began eating.
  3. I will finish working.
Answers
  1. mi puca'o sipna
  2. mi co'a citka
  3. mi bamo'u gunka

items.answer: was ongoing (in the middle of, in the past)

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say aloud:

  1. "I was working." → mi puca'o gunka
  2. "I will start eating." → mi baco'a citka
  3. "I finished." → mi mo'u

Today's Grammar

Combination Meaning
puca'o was ongoing
puco'a had begun
pumo'u had completed
baco'a will begin
baca'o will be ongoing
bamo'u will complete

Summary

You learned to combine tense (pu/ba) with contour (co'a/ca'o/mo'u) for precise time descriptions like "was eating" or "will finish."
